summary: rBmNPV-hPRR bacmid-injected silkworm larvae produced recombinant baculovirus of 1.31 108 plaque forming unit (pfu) in hemolymph. rBmNPV-hPRR was produced in silkworm larvae and purified from its hemolymph using size exclusion chromatography. rBmNPV-hPRR indicates that baculovirus production using silkworm larvae and its purification from hemolymph can provide an economical approach in obtaining the purified BmNPV stocks with high titer for large-scale production of hPRR. also, it can be used for further binding analysis and screening of inhibitors of hPRR. the hemolymph of baculovirus-infected silkworm larvae is used as a high titer-baculovirus solution. the purification of baculovirus from silkworm larval hemolymph has neither been performed nor reported. the rapid method of BmNPV titer measurement was established using quantitative real-time PCR (Q-PCR) cross points for individual baculovirus DNA dilution measured by Q-PCR and titer determination by end-point dilution method have a precise linear correlation with baculovirus titer. titer determination was performed for 142 bp DNA fragment of BmNPV, upstream of ie-1 gene. titer was amplified at the same position as for 142 bp DNA fragment of AcMNPV. recombinant BmNPV was prepared by transfection of recombinant BmNPV bacmid DNA into Bm5 cells. after transfection, BmNPV is required to be amplified several times in order to obtain sufficient virus titer. five milliliter of transfection solution was obtained from 2.5 106 Bm5 cells. hemolymph was also prepared from 13.6 g of rBmNPV-hPRR bacmid. baculovirus number from hemolymph was 2.8 104 times higher than that obtained from transfection solution. 72 pfu/larva (30 l of rBmNPV-hPRR containing 2.38 107 pfu/ml) was enough to infect all silkworm larvae. even the 1:105-diluted hemolymph was still found to be infectious to silkworm larvae. baculovirus solution was prepared by dilution of hemolymph from rBmNPV-hPRR bacmid-injected silkworm larvae with PBS (pH 6.2) white and black bars indicate 4 and 5 days p.i., respectively. purification of rBmNPV-hPRR from larval hemolymph using size exclusion chromatography Hemolymph was harvested from rBmNPV-hPRR containing hemolymph ( the first peak was eluted between 6.5 and 8.5 ml in the void volume. maximum baculovirus titer was 4.86 107 pfu at the fraction 14. the total number of recovered rBmNPV-hPRR was 1.21 108 pfu. lane 4 purified rBmNPV-hPRR from hemolymph by superdex 200 10/300 GL and Sephacryl S-1000 SF column chromatography Volume (ml) Titer (pfu/ml) Virus/Protein (pfu/mg) Recovery (%) Purification (fold) Hemolymph 0.38E+08 1.19E+08 33.2 7.17E+06 100 1 Superdex 200 10/300 GL 2 6. GP64 was detected in the first peak (Fraction 21–23 in Figure 3C) the maximum baculovirus number was 3.21 108 pfu in the fraction 22. recovery yield of rBmNPV-hPRR was 35%, and decreased to 4% by concentration via ultracentrifugation. hemolymph was harvested from rBmNPV-hPRR-injected silkworm larvae at 4, 4.5 and 5 days p.i. it was then centrifuged, and filtered by 0.2 m membrane filter to remove insoluble materials. at 5 days p.i., the baculovirus concentration was 8.29 108 pfu/ml and protein concentration was 43.2 mg/ml of hemolymph, which were the highest among the three hemolymph samples Western blot analysis of hPRR in each purified rBmNPV-hPRR from hemolymph by Sephacryl S-1000 column chromatography. the hPRR was observed in purified rBmNPV-hPRR at 5 days, but not at 4 days. rBmNPV-hPRR is a native form with FLAG peptide sequence. Lane 1, purified rBmNPV-hPRR at 4 days p.i.; lane 2, purified rBmNPV-hPRR at 5 days p.i. pattern of protein bands was not different between purified rBmNPV-hPRR at 4 days p.i. densitometry analysis of each protein band in purified rBmNPV-hPRR at 4 and 5 days p.i. a/f b/f c/f e/f f/f g/f 4 d 0.28 0.34 0.55 0.46 0.32 1 0.4 5 d 0.36 0.41 0.54 0.54 0.88 0.55 compared to that of 4 days p.i. plaque assay [16], end-point dilution method [17] and antibody-based assay [18] have been known as titer determination method for baculoviruses. the antibody for a baculovirus-specific protein, DNA-Binding Protein (DBP) which is expensive is mandatory. single peaks were observed at approximately 82°C. corresponding cross points and determined titers were correlated linearly with a correlation efficiency of 0.99. on 2% agarose gel, DNA fragment at between 100 and 200 bp markers was found without any other bands. transfection of recombinant BmNPV bacmid DNA into Bm5 cells. time to amplify BmNPV is required due to slow growth rate of Bm cells compared to Sf-9 cells. transfection solution 5 9.34E+02 4.67E+03 Hemolymph 0.55 2.38E+08 1.31E+08 Baculovirus titer in larval hemolymph from rBmNPV-hPRR-infected silkworm larvae. baculovirus titer in larval hemolymph was infectious to silkworm larvae. baculovirus number in hemolymph was found to be the highest (9.45 108 pfu/larva) before injection into silkworm larvae, 2.38 103, 2.38 105, 2.38 107 pfu/ml of baculovirus solution was prepared. white and black bars in (A) and (B) indicate 4 and 5 days p.i., respectively. larval hemolymph was filtered with 0.2 m membrane filter. rBmNPV-hPRR was purified by 48-fold by superdex 200 10/300 GL column chromatography and Sephacryl S-1000 SF column chromatography. rBmNPV-hPRR was purified from hemolymph by superdex 200 10/300 GL and Sephacryl S-1000 SF column chromatography. lane 1, hemolymph; lane 2, rBmNPV-hPRR purified by Superdex 200 10/300 GL column chromatography; lane 3, rBmNPV-hPRR purified by Sephacryl S-1000 column chromatography. SF is optimized for purification of DNA, viruses and spherical particles up to 400 nm. seven ml of larval hemolymph (2.91 108 pfu/ml) was applied to Sephacryl S-1000 SF column equilibrated with PBS. every 5 ml fraction was collected as shown in Figure 3C. rBmNPV-hPRR was purified from hemolymph corresponding to each day by Sephacryl S-1000 SF column chromatography. at 5 days p.i., the baculovirus concentration was 8.29 108 pfu/ml and protein concentration was 43.2 mg/ml of hemolymph. 109 pfu/mg at 4 days p.i., which was the purest among the three samples. the hPRR was observed in purified rBmNPV-hPRR at 5 days, but not at 4 days. hPRR of purified rBmNPV-hPRR was detected on reduced condition in Western blotting. hPRR of purified rBmNPV-hPRR was detected on reduced condition in Western blotting with mouse anti-FLAG M2 antibody. rBmNPV-hPRR particles from hemolymph were observed using TEM. envelope proteins in rBmNPV-hPRR from hemolymph were increased at 5 days p.i. rBmNPV-hPRR particles formed around rBmNPV-hPRR particles. TEMs of purified rBmNPV-hPRR from hemolymph at 4 and 5 days p.i. it takes at least a month to amplify baculoviruses up to a sufficient titer. using hemolymph as a baculovirus stock to increase baculovirus titer can thus save time, cost and labor. mNPV-hPRR per mg of protein decreased at 5 days p.i. compared to 4 days p.i. but protein-band pattern in purified rBmNPV-hPRR was similar. but proteins of which rBmNPV-hPRR is composed may increase at 5 days p.i. rBmNPV-hPRR contains its titer in higher amount of BmNPV. a higher titer of rBmNPV-hPRR solution (4.50 109 pfu/ml) was obtained from silkworm larval hemolymph. rBmNPV-hPRR bacmid was constructed using Escherichia coli BmDH10Bac [34], which was transfected in Bm5 cells. titration assay using quantitative real-time PCR Baculoviral DNA was extracted by High Pure Viral Nucleic Acid Kit (Stratagene, La Jolla, CA, USA) l of 2 FullVelocity SYBR Green QPCR master mix, 1:500-diluted reference dye, and 0.1 M Bmie-1-F and Bmie-1-R primers. PCR amplification and melting curves were analyzed by MxPro software (Stratagene) production and purification of rBmNPV from larval hemolymph was performed by injecting 30 l of 100-fold phosphate buffered saline (PBS)-diluted ifugation at 114000 g with 25% sucrose cushion (25% sucrose in 5 mM NaCl and 10 mM EDTA) Particles were suspended with a small volume of PBS (pH 6.2) SDS-PAGE and Western blot Proteins were separated by sodium dodecyl sulfate-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. agarose blocks were dehydrated in ethanol and embedded in an Epon/Araldite mixture. the ultrathin sections were stained with uranyl acetate and lead citrate. rBmNPV-hPRR is a native form with FLAG peptide sequence behind its signal peptide sequence. rBmNPV-hPRR bacmid was harvested after 6 days cultivation. titration assay using quantitative real-time PCR Baculoviral DNA was extracted by high pure Viral Nucleic Acid Kit. l of 100-fold phosphate buffered saline (PBS)-diluted hemolymph was centrifuged at 20000 g for 10 min. the collected supernatant is then applied to superdex 200 10/300 GL column. each 0.5 or 5 ml of fraction was collected in case of superdex 200 10/300 GL column. membrane was washed with TBST or 1:4000 diluted rabbit anti-Bmgp64 polyclonal antibody for 1 hour. the membrane was then incubated in 1:20,000 diluted anti-mouse or anti-rabbit IgG antibody labeled with horseradish peroxidase for 1 hour. bands were detected using a Fluor-S/MAX multi-imager (Bio-Rad) all authors have read and approved the manuscript. the work was partly supported by grant-in-aid for scientific research.
